New Zealand Herald https://www.nzherald.co.nz New Zealand Herald News Feed 2023 年 12 月 3 日，星期日 14:05:02 +0000 zh 1每小时1
The Opportunities Party leader Raf Manji resigns https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/opportunities-party-leader-raf-manji-resigns/S4D53TM5PJGIHB7AMBBSPY24QI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/opportunities-party-leader-raf-manji-resigns/S4D53TM5PJGIHB7AMBBSPY24QI/ Raf Manji is standing down after failing to get into Parliament this election. Sun, 03 Dec 2023 08:07:06 +0000 Raf Manji became the leader of the Opportunities Party in January 2022. Photo / RNZ
Police arrest man in connection with alleged Te Whatu Ora mass privacy breach of Covid vaccination data https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-arrest-man-in-connection-with-alleged-te-whatu-ora-mass-privacy-breach-of-covid-vaccination-data/SF3KR4MIJRGXRPXMB22XND74D4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-arrest-man-in-connection-with-alleged-te-whatu-ora-mass-privacy-breach-of-covid-vaccination-data/SF3KR4MIJRGXRPXMB22XND74D4/ Benjamin Plummer, Lincoln TanA 56yr old man is charged with accessing a computer system for dishonest purposes. Sun, 03 Dec 2023 08:02:28 +0000 Te Whatu Ora said the former employee had no clinical background or expert vaccine knowledge, and there was no evidence vaccination was responsible for 'excess mortality in New Zealand'. Photo / Getty Images
NZ’s fifth Covid-19 wave prompts six-fold bump in booster shots https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/nzs-fifth-covid-19-wave-prompts-six-fold-bump-in-boosting/6XOJCSDXKNGMHNE74FO3YQXW7Q/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/nzs-fifth-covid-19-wave-prompts-six-fold-bump-in-boosting/6XOJCSDXKNGMHNE74FO3YQXW7Q/ Jamie MortonOfficials say there's been a 'significant' jump in vaccinations since early November. Sun, 03 Dec 2023 06:55:43 +0000 Deputy-director of Public Health Dr Harriette Carr said there’d been a “significant” increase in adult vaccinations since early November. Photo / Andrew Warner
Canterbury fatal crash: One dead after quad bike rolls near Rakaia https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/canterbury-fatal-crash-one-dead-after-quad-bike-rolls-in-methven/SXRBNLPZVRDQLCIGROCYVW2OFU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/canterbury-fatal-crash-one-dead-after-quad-bike-rolls-in-methven/SXRBNLPZVRDQLCIGROCYVW2OFU/An investigation into the crash is under way.Sun, 03 Dec 2023 06:37:00 +0000 Emergency services were called to the single-vehicle crash on Back Track, Methven about 10.30pm on Saturday.
Floral tributes laid by locals at Rothesay Bay on Auckland’s North Shore following water-related death last night https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/floral-tributes-laid-by-locals-at-rothesay-bay-on-aucklands-north-shore-following-water-lated-death-last-night/ YS3SSSDGSJHWRJELKSASXO6MKQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/floral-tributes-laid-by-locals-at-rothesay-bay-on-aucklands-north-shore-following-water-lated-death-last-night/ YS3SSSDGSJHWRJELKSASXO6MKQ/ Benjamin PlummerResidents said the death was a shock to the community. Ex-sprinter chases thief caught stealing television at Auckland mall https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ex-sprinter-chases-man-caught-stealing-a-television/6ZTWI6WDOJGNZO643IJRMVTUAU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ex-sprinter-chases-man-caught-stealing-a-television/6ZTWI6WDOJGNZO643IJRMVTUAU/ An ex-sprinter helped police track down an alleged thief as he attempted a sneaky getaway. Sun, 03 Dec 2023 05:57:27 +0000 A police spokesperson said they located the offender a short distance from the scene and a 41-year-old male was charged with shoplifting. Photo / Bevan Conley
Te Whatu Ora granted urgent injunction, police complaint filed over mass privacy breach of Covid vaccination data by staff member https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/te-whatu-ora-granted-urgent-injunction-police-complaint-filed-over-mass-privacy-breach-of-covid-19-vaccination-data-作者：前工作人员/EUKC3NHC6FAOVL2YJSE4GUR6BU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/te-whatu-ora-granted-urgent-injunction-police-complaint-filed-over-mass-privacy-breach-of-covid-19-vaccination-data-作者：前工作人员/EUKC3NHC6FAOVL2YJSE4GUR6BU/ Lincoln TanTe Whatu Ora says it is doing 'everything [it] can' to respond to the incident. Sun, 03 Dec 2023 05:47:31 +0000 Te Whatu Ora said the former employee had no clinical background or expert vaccine knowledge, and there was no evidence vaccination was responsible for 'excess mortality in New Zealand'. Photo / Getty Images
Canterbury Crate Day punters anger activists by breaking endangered birds’ eggs https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/canterbury-crate-day-punters-anger-activists-by-writing-endangered-birds-eggs/FTARS3H4LFCRVFHJURHUHSMUOM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/canterbury-crate-day-punters-anger-activists-by-writing-endangered-birds-eggs/FTARS3H4LFCRVFHJURHUHSMUOM/ Emma Stanford'About 150' 4WDs sped over a riverbed, which threw stones up that broke tarapiroe eggs. Photo / Grant Davey
Controversial cold case DNA tool: Privacy Commissioner asks police to suspend use pending legislative reform https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/controversial-cold-case-dna-tool-privacy-commissioner-asks-police-to-suspend-use-pending-legislative-reform/VQBXYWS7LVAKHN6P7QSCAAAH6I/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/controversial-cold-case-dna-tool-privacy-commissioner-asks-police-to-suspend-use-pending-legislative-reform/VQBXYWS7LVAKHN6P7QSCAAAH6I/ Sam Sherwood, Jared SavagePolice are trialling the tool on two of the country's most high-profile cases.
